chunks.title: Aether X1 — ANC cuts out during calls
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Noise cancellation works for music but intermittently disables during phone or video calls, especially when switching apps or devices.

Quick checks:
Confirm the headphones are fully charged. Verify the firmware is up to date using the Protis control app. Check whether the headphones are connected to more than one device at the same time.

Steps:
1) Disconnect the headphones from all devices.
2) Power the headphones off, then hold the power and volume-down buttons together for 10 seconds to reset.
3) Pair the headphones to a single primary device only.
4) Disable any system-level call audio enhancements or spatial audio features on the connected device.
5) Test a call using the default system dialer or a known-good calling app.

Escalate/Next:
If ANC still disengages during calls after a reset and single-device pairing, note the phone/OS version and contact support for further diagnostics. Extended call-mode ANC limitations may apply depending on the calling app and codec in use.

chunks.title: Pulse ANC Earbuds — one earbud drains faster
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
One earbud consistently reaches low battery well before the other during normal use.

Quick checks:
Confirm both earbuds were fully charged in the case. Clean charging contacts on both earbuds and inside the case.

Steps:
1) Place both earbuds in the charging case and leave the lid open for 30 seconds.
2) Remove both earbuds and reinsert them to force a full sync.
3) Use both earbuds together for a full session rather than single-ear use.
4) Disable transparency or ANC temporarily and compare drain rates.

Escalate/Next:
If the imbalance persists after multiple full charge cycles, the battery may be aging unevenly. Contact support to evaluate replacement options under warranty or service coverage.

chunks.title: Pulse Sport Earbuds — ear hooks feel loose during activity
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Earbuds feel unstable or shift position during running or workouts.

Quick checks:
Verify the correct ear hook size is installed and that left/right hooks are not swapped.

Steps:
1) Remove the ear hooks and reinstall, ensuring they click firmly into place.
2) Try a larger hook size to increase tension behind the ear.
3) Insert the earbud first, then rotate slightly backward to seat the hook securely.
4) Use the earbuds without ANC for sports if wind noise is causing perceived looseness.

Escalate/Next:
If the hooks do not remain secure even with correct sizing, contact support to request replacement hooks or fit guidance.

chunks.title: Lumina 32 — visible banding in HDR mode
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Gradients appear stepped or uneven when HDR is enabled, particularly in dark scenes.

Quick checks:
Confirm the monitor is connected via DisplayPort or HDMI capable of HDR. Ensure HDR is enabled both on the monitor and in the operating system.

Steps:
1) Disable any third-party color enhancement or GPU driver overrides.
2) Set the monitor to its default HDR preset.
3) Verify the content being viewed is true HDR content.
4) Update GPU drivers to the latest stable release.

Escalate/Next:
If banding persists, this may be a limitation of the content source or system output rather than the panel itself. Support can help validate signal settings.

chunks.title: Lumina 27 Edge — signal drops at high refresh rates
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
The screen briefly goes black or loses signal when set to high refresh rates.

Quick checks:
Confirm you are using a certified high-bandwidth DisplayPort cable.

Steps:
1) Lower the refresh rate to confirm stability.
2) Replace the cable with a shorter, certified cable.
3) Disable adaptive sync temporarily.
4) Test another display output on the same system.

Escalate/Next:
Persistent signal loss may indicate cable or GPU compatibility limitations. Contact support with system details for further guidance.

chunks.title: Helios Pro — camera overheats during 8K recording
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Recording stops automatically after extended 8K video capture.

Quick checks:
Confirm ambient temperature and remove any external accessories trapping heat.

Steps:
1) Allow the camera to cool before resuming recording.
2) Reduce frame rate or switch to 4K for longer sessions.
3) Disable unused wireless features during recording.
4) Update to the latest firmware.

Escalate/Next:
Extended 8K capture is thermally intensive. If overheating occurs unusually quickly, contact support for evaluation.

chunks.title: Helios Compact — camera will not power on
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Camera does not respond when the power button is pressed.

Quick checks:
Verify the battery is charged and inserted correctly.

Steps:
1) Remove and reseat the battery.
2) Charge the battery externally if available.
3) Remove memory card and attempt power-on.
4) Inspect battery contacts for debris.

Escalate/Next:
If the camera remains unresponsive, support can assist with diagnostics or service options.

chunks.title: Orion Mechanical Keyboard — keys not registering
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Certain keys fail to register unless pressed firmly.

Quick checks:
Confirm no debris is present under the keycaps.

Steps:
1) Remove the affected keycap and inspect the switch.
2) Reseat the switch firmly if hot-swappable.
3) Test the keyboard on another computer.
4) Reset the keyboard to default settings.

Escalate/Next:
If multiple switches are affected, contact support for repair or replacement guidance.

chunks.title: Orion Mini — missing arrow keys confusion
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
User cannot locate arrow keys on the keyboard.

Quick checks:
Review the key legends for secondary functions.

Steps:
1) Use the function key in combination with designated keys to access arrows.
2) Reference the included layout guide.
3) Remap keys using supported software if preferred.

Escalate/Next:
If the layout is unsuitable, support can assist with exchange or alternative recommendations.

chunks.title: Nova Studio Speakers — static at low volume
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
A faint hiss or static is audible at very low volume levels.

Quick checks:
Confirm cables are balanced and securely connected.

Steps:
1) Lower the output gain at the source and raise speaker volume slightly.
2) Test with a different audio source.
3) Ensure speakers are connected to a grounded outlet.

Escalate/Next:
Low-level noise can be inherent in high-gain systems. Support can help assess whether the noise level is within specification.

chunks.title: Nova Air — noticeable audio latency with TV
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Audio lags behind video when connected to a television.

Quick checks:
Verify connection type and audio output settings on the TV.

Steps:
1) Enable any available audio sync adjustment on the TV.
2) Use a wired connection if available.
3) Disable unnecessary wireless features.

Escalate/Next:
Wireless speakers may exhibit latency unsuitable for video editing or live viewing. Support can recommend configuration options.

chunks.title: Lumina Monitor Arm — arm sags at full height
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Monitor slowly lowers after adjustment.

Quick checks:
Confirm the monitor weight is within the supported range.

Steps:
1) Use the tension adjustment screw to increase resistance.
2) Rebalance the arm with the monitor attached.
3) Verify mounting screws are tight.

Escalate/Next:
If sagging persists, support can assist with replacement or adjustment guidance.

chunks.title: Aether X1 — initial setup and pairing
chunks.content: This guide walks through first-time setup of the Aether X1. Charge the headphones fully using the included cable. Power on by holding the power button for three seconds until the indicator flashes. Open Bluetooth settings on your device and select Aether X1. Once paired, install the Protis control app to check for firmware updates and configure ANC modes. For best results, complete setup on a single device before enabling multipoint.

chunks.content: Connect power and a high-quality display cable. Select the correct input source. For creative work, apply the factory calibration profile or perform custom calibration using supported tools. Adjust brightness and HDR settings based on ambient lighting.

chunks.title: Orion Keyboard — setup and customization
chunks.content: Connect the keyboard via USB-C. Allow the system to recognize the device. Optional software can be used for remapping keys and lighting. Hot-swappable switches can be replaced by gently removing keycaps and switches with the provided tool.

chunks.title: Nova Air — wireless setup
chunks.content: Power on the speakers and follow the pairing instructions for Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. Run room calibration if prompted to optimize sound. Place speakers symmetrically for best results.

chunks.title: Aether Lite — Bluetooth pairing fails
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
The headphones do not appear in the Bluetooth device list or fail to connect after selection.

Quick checks:
Ensure the headphones are charged and not currently connected to another device.

Steps:
1) Power off the headphones completely.
2) Hold the power button for 5 seconds until the pairing indicator flashes.
3) Disable and re-enable Bluetooth on the source device.
4) Remove any previous Aether Lite entries from the device’s Bluetooth list.
5) Attempt pairing again in a low-interference environment.

Escalate/Next:
If pairing continues to fail across multiple devices, support can assist with further diagnostics or replacement evaluation.

chunks.title: Arc Webcam Pro — image appears soft in low light
chunks.content:
Symptoms:
Video appears blurry or soft in dim lighting conditions.

Quick checks:
Confirm adequate ambient lighting and clean the camera lens.

Steps:
1) Increase room lighting facing the subject.
2) Disable digital zoom and background effects.
3) Adjust exposure settings in the video application.
4) Test the webcam in another application to compare results.

Escalate/Next:
Low-light performance depends heavily on lighting conditions. If clarity remains poor in well-lit environments, contact support for evaluation.

chunks.title: Arc Webcam Lite — focus does not adjust

Quick checks:

Steps:

2) Ensure no protective film is covering the lens.
3) Restart the video application.
4) Test on another computer if available.

Escalate/Next:
If focus remains incorrect within normal usage distance, support can help determine if service is needed.

4) Verify the power source and cable are functioning.

Escalate/Next:
If charging does not initiate, support can assist with repair or replacement options.

chunks.title: initiate_return Tool - Standard Operating Procedure
chunks.content:
PROCEDURE: initiate_return Tool Usage

STEP 1: Verify Order Details
- ALWAYS call order_status first to retrieve full order information
- Review all items in the order and their quantities
- Note the order total for comparison

STEP 2: Determine Return Scope
If customer mentions specific items AND order has multiple items:
  - Ask: 'Which specific item(s) would you like to return?'
  - Ask: 'How many units of each item?' (if order contains quantities > 1)
  - Document customer's specific product choices
  - REQUIRED: Use product_ids and quantities parameters
  - Example: product_ids=[2, 5], quantities=[1, 2]

If customer wants to return entire order:
  - Confirm: 'Just to confirm, you want to return all items from this order?'
  - Do NOT specify product_ids or quantities parameters
  - Let the system default to full order return

STEP 3: Call initiate_return
Partial return syntax:
  initiate_return(
    order_id=123,
    return_reason='customer explanation',
    product_ids=[1, 3],
    quantities=[2, 1]
  )

Full return syntax:
  initiate_return(
    order_id=123,
    return_reason='customer explanation'
  )

CRITICAL RULES:
- NEVER omit product_ids when customer wants partial return - this refunds ENTIRE order
- ALWAYS match array lengths: len(product_ids) == len(quantities)
- ALWAYS verify product_ids exist in the order before calling
- Refund amount is calculated automatically based on items returned
- Each product_id creates a separate return record in the database

STEP 4: Confirm with Customer
- State which items are being returned
- Provide the refund amount from the tool response
- Explain next steps (inspection, processing time, etc.)

chunks.title: draft_order Tool - Standard Operating Procedure
chunks.content:
PROCEDURE: draft_order Tool Usage

PURPOSE:
The draft_order tool validates order information BEFORE creating an actual order. Use this to identify missing information and avoid incomplete order submissions.

STEP 1: When to Use
- Customer expresses intent to place an order
- Customer mentions wanting to buy products
- Before EVERY create_order call

STEP 2: Gather Information Progressively
- Call draft_order with whatever information you have so far
- Pass all known fields, use null/empty for unknown fields
- Review the response for missing_fields array

STEP 3: Request Missing Information
- Ask for missing items naturally in conversation
- Do NOT use forms or structured lists
- Example: 'I'll need your shipping address to complete this order. Where should we send it?'

STEP 4: Iterate Until Complete
- Call draft_order again after collecting more information
- Continue until ready_to_order = true

STEP 5: Validate Product Information
- draft_order checks product availability and inventory
- draft_order calculates total cost and weight
- Review the order_summary provided

STEP 6: Only Then Create Order
- When ready_to_order = true, call create_order with complete information
- Use exact same parameters validated by draft_order

CRITICAL RULES:
- NEVER call create_order without successful draft_order first
- NEVER proceed if draft_order shows inventory issues
- ALWAYS pass product_ids and quantities as arrays of same length
- Product IDs must be integers from the catalog

chunks.title: create_order Tool - Standard Operating Procedure
chunks.content:
PROCEDURE: create_order Tool Usage

PREREQUISITES:
- draft_order has been called and returned ready_to_order = true
- All required information has been collected and validated
- Customer has confirmed they want to proceed

REQUIRED PARAMETERS:
- customer_name: Full name as string
- customer_email: Valid email address
- customer_phone: Phone number with country code if applicable
- street_address: street and house number
- city: address's city name
- state: address's state
- zip: zip code for the address
- product_ids: Array of integer product IDs (e.g., [1, 2, 3])
- quantities: Array of integers matching product_ids length (e.g., [2, 1, 1])

STEP 1: Final Confirmation
- Summarize the order for the customer
- State total cost from draft_order
- Confirm shipping address
- Get explicit confirmation to proceed

STEP 2: Call create_order
- Use exact parameters validated by draft_order
- All arrays must match in length
- All required fields must be present

STEP 3: Handle Response
Success:
  - Note the order_id from response
  - Provide order_id to customer immediately
  - Explain next steps (processing, shipping estimate)
  
Failure:
  - If inventory error: product sold out since draft, offer alternatives
  - If validation error: review parameters and retry
  - If system error: create support ticket

CRITICAL RULES:
- This action is IRREVERSIBLE - inventory is deducted immediately
- NEVER call twice for same order (check for existing order_id)
- ALWAYS provide order_id to customer for their records
- Order cannot be modified after creation - only cancelled/returned

chunks.title: order_status Tool - Standard Operating Procedure
chunks.content:
PROCEDURE: order_status Tool Usage

PURPOSE:
Retrieve complete information about an existing order including status, items, and amounts.

WHEN TO USE:
- Customer asks about their order
- Before processing returns (to see what items were ordered)
- Before answering questions about order contents
- To verify order exists before other operations

PARAMETERS:
- order_id: Integer order ID (required)

STEP 1: Obtain Order ID
- Ask customer for order number if not provided
- Order IDs are integers (e.g., 123, 456)
- Validate it's a number before calling

STEP 2: Call order_status
- Pass order_id as integer
- Tool returns complete order object with items array

STEP 3: Review Response
Success response contains:
  - order_id, status, customer details
  - items: array of products with quantities and prices
  - total_amount: order total
  - created_at, updated_at: timestamps

STEP 4: Provide Information
- Translate status codes to customer-friendly language
- Summarize items clearly
- Provide relevant dates and use item names instead of IDs

STATUS CODES:
- pending: Order received, being processed
- processing: Being prepared for shipment
- shipped: On its way to customer
- delivered: Successfully delivered
- cancelled: Order was cancelled

CRITICAL RULES:
- ALWAYS check order status before initiating returns
- Use the items array to identify specific products in the order
- Prices shown are at time of purchase, not current prices

chunks.title: product_catalog Tool - Standard Operating Procedure
chunks.content:
PROCEDURE: product_catalog Tool Usage

PURPOSE:
Search and browse available products by category or search terms.

OPTIONAL PARAMETERS:
- category: Filter by category (headphone, camera, keyboard, speaker, monitor, accessory) - use SINGULAR form, case-insensitive
- search_query: Search in product names and descriptions

STEP 1: Determine Search Strategy
Customer browses category:
  - Use category parameter with SINGULAR form
  - Example: category='headphone' (not 'headphones')
  - Example: category='keyboard' (not 'keyboards')
  - Example: category='monitor' (not 'monitors')

Customer searches for specific item:
  - Use search_query parameter
  - Example: search_query='wireless keyboard'

Customer wants everything:
  - Call with no parameters to get full catalog

STEP 2: Call product_catalog
- Can use category and search_query together for refined results
- Returns array of product objects
- Categories are automatically normalized to singular lowercase

STEP 3: Present Results
- Show product names, prices, and brief descriptions
- Note stock availability
- Provide product IDs for ordering
- Offer to narrow down if many results

PRODUCT OBJECT CONTAINS:
- id: Product ID (use for orders)
- name: Product name
- price: Current price
- description: Product details
- category: Product category
- stock_quantity: Available inventory

CRITICAL RULES:
- ALWAYS use SINGULAR category names (headphone, not headphones)
- Category matching is case-insensitive
- Stock quantity shown is current availability
- Prices may change between browsing and ordering
- Product IDs are required for draft_order and create_order
- If stock_quantity = 0, product is out of stock

chunks.title: estimate_shipping Tool - Standard Operating Procedure
chunks.content:
PROCEDURE: estimate_shipping Tool Usage

PURPOSE:
Provide shipping cost estimates for different service levels based on destination and weight.

REQUIRED PARAMETERS:
- destination_zip: ZIP/postal code as string (e.g., '10001')
- weight: Package weight in pounds as number

STEP 1: Gather Information
- Ask for destination ZIP code if not provided
- Weight is usually available from draft_order's total_weight
- For manual estimates, ask customer for approximate weight

STEP 2: Call estimate_shipping
- Pass ZIP as string (preserve leading zeros)
- Pass weight as float or integer
- Tool returns ALL available service levels for that ZIP

STEP 3: Present Options
Response includes array of estimates with:
  - carrier: Shipping carrier name
  - service_type: Service level (standard, express, overnight)
  - estimated_cost: Total shipping cost
  - estimated_days: Delivery time estimate

Present as options:
  'Here are the shipping options to [ZIP]:
   - [Carrier] [Service]: $[cost] ([days] days)
   - [Carrier] [Service]: $[cost] ([days] days)'

STEP 4: Handle No Results
- If tool returns no estimates, ZIP may not be serviceable
- Suggest customer verify ZIP code
- Offer to create support ticket for special shipping arrangements

CRITICAL RULES:
- Shipping costs are estimates, final cost determined at fulfillment
- Delivery times are estimates, not guarantees
- Weight significantly affects cost
- Some ZIPs may have limited service options
